is a city in the west of the Dutch province of
. Situated on the border of neighbouring province

, the city lies on the hills of the "Brabantse wal", an area heightened over the centuries under influence of the river Schelde and the Sea. The area is dotted with historic estates and large parts of it are natural reserves, making it a fine destination for hikers. Bergen op Zoom itself is known as pleasant and historic city, packed with monumental buildings, plenty of good shopping opportunities and many welcoming cafés.
This is a historical city with about 66,000 inhabitants and a strategic location close to both
. Nevertheless it has the typical atmosphere of a North-Brabant city. It is said that hotel De Draak is the oldest hotel in the Netherlands.

Bergen op Zoom originated in the Middle Ages from the combined growth of three small settlements. It was walled in 1330 and received city rights in 1347 . The city was the administrative center of the area. From 1533, the lords of the city from the house of
were allowed to carry the title of Marquis. Their palace (
) is a museum now. About 1500, Bergen op Zoom was, with its port on the Oosterschelde and its fairs, a major trade competitor for

. Two differing influences caused a decline: massive floods with storm surges to the hinterland and the impact of the Eighty Years' War (1568–1648).

In 1577, during the Eighty Years' War, the Spanish who were expelled from the city, made numerous attempts to recapture it: In 1581 and 1588 (by

).

The fort of Bergen op Zoom was created in 1688 by
and was considered one of the strongest fortresses of the Low Countries. However, in 1747 it was taken by the French general
after a three-month siege. Just one year later, due to the

, the Frence had to evacuate the fort.

On 30 January 1795 Bergen op Zoom was handed over to the French without a fight. In 1814 after a successful attempt by the general

the fort was taken by the British and the French had to leave again.

In 1867 the fort was abandoned and dismantled.

value: content=Friendly staff with extensive information about Bergen op Zoom and surroundings.

Bergen op Zoom is on the junction of highways from North to South (A4 and A17) and East to West (A58) making it easy to reach the city by car. Long time parking in the center is only possible in payed parking lots.  Garages in the center are:
you need a change in Roosendaal. Intercity trains arrive and depart twice per hour. The railway station is east of the inner city and on less than 1 km walking distance from the
The public transport in Bergen op Zoom and to/from Roosendaal is done by
. The bus station is next to the railway station.
Visiting the historical inner city is best done by foot because some streets and squares are pedestrian areas.

value: content=To rent a bike, you need valid identification. You pay a deposit ranging from €50 (for the simplest bike) to €145 (for a tandem). A brand bicycle without gears with coaster costs about €7.50 to €15 per day. This includes insurance against theft.

content=The Gevangenpoort (prison gate) is the oldest monument of the city. The gate dates from the 14th century and is one of the remaining examples of gates as they were in the Middle Ages in Dutch towns. It is the only remaining city gate in Bergen op Zoom, and a national monument.
content=The Grote Markt is the central square of Bergen op Zoom and the oldest part of town. It's surrounded by historical buildings like the Town Hall and Hotel de Draak.
content=The Markiezenhof is a late Gothic palace, residence of the lords and later the marquis of Bergen op Zoom. Today it hosts exhibitions and events.

content=The oldest part of the church is the body of the tower, which dates from around 1370. The present church building, completed in 1477, was designed by Everaert Spoorwater. He designed a new choir with ambulatory, chapels and side chapels in the ship in the style of Brabant Gothic.
content=A late Gothic building origin from 1398. Several city fires put the building to ashes. The current composite building dates from 1600.
Make a city walk, visit the Markiezenhof museum and the Sint-Gertrudis church.

is the only part that remains of the city wall. It is an early eighteenth century fortress with underground passages. On less then 1km walking distance from the Grote Markt, it is a perfect location for rest or a picnic.
image=Bergen op Zoom, de Maagd foto2 2010-09-11 09.17.JPG

content= This theater in the historic heart of Bergen op Zoom owes its atmosphere with the international architecture award-winning transformation from church to theater. De Maagd offers over 100 performances per season and is a popular location for meetings and events
directions=South of Bergen op Zoom just north of airport Woensdrecht

content= The Brabant shore is a hilly area south of Bergen op Zoom that separates the clay area of Zeeland and the sandy soils of Brabant. This creates a very diverse presence of plant and bird species. The
estate are located here. The estate includes a beautiful English and French garden, pond, English Tea House, coach houses and Orangery.

). Traditionally the carnival revelers wear a scarf of lace curtain and a red handkerchief.

For a small town with around 60,000 inhabitants Bergen op Zoom has a large variety of restaurants of generally good quality.

value: hours=Thu-Sat 18:00. Sun 12:00. Wed-Fri lunch 12:00-14:30. Mon closed
, maybe not an inspiring name but this cosy old restaurant (1797) serves populair dishes with a good quality-price ratio.
content=This is the restaurant of hotel De Draak with a nice terrace on the central square

Bergen op Zoom has no shortage of cafes and pubs. You will find several on the Grote Markt.

value: content=It calls itself Curiositeitencafé (curiosity cafe). When you see the interior you'll understand why
content=Owned by the same family since the opening in 1880. Recently expanded with a 200 seats theater.
content=Hotel Old Dutch is located opposite the railway station in a historic building.
content=The oldest hotel of Bergen op Zoom and maybe of the Netherlands.
content=This hotel has 13 rooms. It has a bridal suite for €125 with a view over the Grote Markt.
content=This hotel has only 6 rooms and is situated opposite the Markiezenhof. The €9.95 breakfast is not included.

The international telephone country code for the Netherlands is 31, the area code for Bergen op Zoom is 0164. If dialing from abroad, use +31 but then leave out the 0 in the area code.

Free

spots are available in most hotels and libraries.
